data.text:
Around $500,000 on maintenance and upgrades has been spent at The Trusts Arena (formerly Stadium) over the Christmas break, with no amount of the capital funding coming from ratepayers' money. Work has been done on the arena's sports floor, improved lighting and better changing facilities installed, and plans are to update technology across the venue.

The Trusts Arena CEO Brian Blake says the venue is a New Zealand success story with a national and international reputation - and that is a key to it remaining widely accessible and affordable to the public.
